author: Anisha
text:
f I could I would give zero stars.

I ordered an item in November. A month later its shows as stuck in transit / on the way and so on. All of this time I have had conversations and updates from the seller without any issues.

Then randomly Vinted updates the item as delivered and released money to the seller. The tracking still showed the item as in transit. I was not notified its delivered - as far as I knew, I still had to wait for the item to be delivered to the shop for collection. I kept waiting. When I contacted the seller, as expected, no response even after a week although till she received the money I exchanged updates everyday.

I then contacted Vinted. Vinted realised they had messed up but would not back down. They claimed item was delivered on the 13th although could not provide any evidence or proof. I sent screenshots on tracking which till 18th shows as in transit. They didn't say anything to address this. From what I see online now, this appears to be a common scam from Vinted. They mess up and then ask buyer to deal directly with the seller although they very well know seller won't bother to respond. I am not giving up, if only for the principle of it. I am happy to go through all legal routes so Vinted can once and for all stop this organised scam. I have all the proof and evidence I need for a legal case so happy to take this forward.

My tips for others - I have learnt my lesson, will not be buying from Vinted anymore.
title: Organised scam run by Vinted

author: Jonathan Hawes
text: I bought a shirt on Vinted thinking it was a mens medium. It turned out to be womens medium and was far too small for me. The buttons fastened from the opposite side too. It went to a Vinted decision and they ruled in favour of the seller. Im £25 out of pocket. This is very unfair and I will never use Vinted again. The arrogance of the staff as I pleaded for a reversal in their decision is abhorrent.  I also had past experiences of buying stuff that was already sold and Vinted users who never send the stuff. Stick to Ebay in which you get better customer service and consumer protection. Do not use the Vinted app.

author: Miss M
text:
Avoid Vinted like the plague! And tell others to do so too!

Absolutely terrible, I wish I could leave minus stars.

I will never sell or buy from Vinted again, and I will continually dissuade the use of this app to everyone I know. This app facilitates scam buyers. As a seller you are not protected here, I recommend eBay, Amazon or Depop, NOT Vinted. 

I sold a bundle of 2 books, upon their arrival to the buyer she claims I only sent her one book. I know this is not true. I am meticulous with my checks and I no longer have the “missing” book in my possession. I asked for proof that she only received one, she sends me a picture of the package which has clearly been opened, had a book removed, and then resealed with tape to look like there’s one missing. In the photo the package is covered in a tonne of tape and it has clear rough edges that have been hacked at with scissors, I know I didn’t send it in this condition because I use bags with sticky tabs! I don’t use tape to seal the bag, only to attach the label. It is painfully clear that the package has been tampered with by the buyer. The buyer of course is unresponsive to my messages, and will not reach an agreement with me (because she wants to scam me). I then have to involve Vinted support and unsurprisingly, they rule in the buyers favour, now she has 2 of my books and her money back as well! Vinted told me that because I didn’t use a cardboard box to send 2 small paper back books, they’re not liable! Their guidance does not state the use of cardboard boxes is mandatory, only ideal. Also, would this have ended differently if I used a cardboard box? Probably not! I’d still be out of pocket. 

It’s absolutely disgusting that this has been allowed. I accept that she has scammed me out of one book, but on top of this, the buyer did still send photographic evidence of having one of the books in her possession. So, I point this out to Vinted and they tell me once again that because I didn’t use a cardboard box they won’t do anything, and they also closed the case not allowing me to reply! What?! Where is the money for this book the buyer has shown she’s received? Vinted has facilitated a scammer to steal from me. In fact, handy tip incoming: I’ve learned that if you want something for free off of Vinted, just pretend it didn’t come! Tamper with the packaging and it’s all yours, and so is your money! 

Thank goodness these books weren’t worth too much. I’m sure this happens constantly to other sellers with much more expensive items, and I feel awful for those sellers who have faced what I did and the horrendously insulting Vinted support. 

So, thanks Vinted, I am now two books down and I have nothing to show for it!

If you want to lose your items and your money, Vinted is the place for you!
title: Avoid Vinted like the plague.

author: Sasha Temple
text:
AN ABSOLUTE DISGRACE! DEFRAUDED ME OUT OF 900EUROS!!!
A very long story short, I bought a Loius Vuitton bag on Vinted which arrived 24/01/22, it was a beautiful bag, but it wasnt really practical for me, so put the same bag on Vinted for sale on the 01/02/22. Vinted then deleted my advert because the bag was not authentic!!! When I asked them to refund my 900Euros for the fake bag I was sold the week before on their site. They refused!!!!

1st they said we try to ensure we adhere to the laws regrding counterfeit goods, but we didnt notice this one on time, many apologies for the inconvenience. 

Then when I said, this is an absolute disgrace, you cannot allow a buyer to pay 900Euros for a fake bag and a week later refuse to offer a refund, afterall you pay buyer protection when you make the purchase. Total silence, I have been ghosted by Vinted customer services. 

I was completely unaware that it was not authentic, it came in the box, with the dust bag, code inside, absolutely identical to the one on the Louis Vuitton website.
